result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Hobbick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant, Ryan J Hobbick, in custody, appeared with Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Denise Campbell DOC agent in court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(3:04)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State goes over corrections on PSI - total number of adult criminal convictions are 17
Harrelson goes over any corrections on PSI - deft doesn't disagree with 17 prior convictions
Court questions Denise Campbell on costs/restitution - goes over PSI with individual after having it done and he didn't have any discrepencies with it
State - argues sentence & addresses the three primary factors - sentence deft to 9 yrs total confinement 5 yrs IC 4 yrs ES, credit 89 days - absolute sobriety, no rest, $268 cc, $250 dna, $10 drug, no contact with A-Z salvage yard and Michael Larson - victims rights complied with
Harrelson - argues sentencing - requests 6 yrs prob w/held sentence with reasonable conditional jail time - requests huber release - submits letter by Karen Anderson to Court - agrees with credit of 89 days
Mrs. Hobbick - addresses the court
Ryan Hobbick addresses the court
Court addresses the defendant

COURT:  15CF50 - Prison 8 yrs - IC 3 yrs ES 5 yrs - credit 89 days already served
$268 cc
$250 dna surchg
$  10 drug
***PAYMENT PLAN***
Conditions of ES:
no contact with A-Z salvage yard and Michael Larson
maintain absolute sobriety
eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse

Set other matters for status 15CF002, 15CF052, 16CF248 set for half hour  - - August 23, 2016 at 3:00 p.m.***
